text: Packing a Prism: Volume of Right Prisms

Gabriel recalled from the Covering and Surrounding unit that to calculate the exact volume of a rectangular prism, we can visualize packing it with layers of identical unit cubes. This works well for square prisms. Gabriel claims it works for all right prisms.

Sometimes it is impossible to pack a prism with unit cubes, but a visual image may help. The figures show how you could visualize packing this prism with unit cubes and parts of unit cubes.
